title: What is a healthy example of an assassin?
body:
This is a serious question. Everyone's definitions vary of what a healthy assassin should be. With the assassin class update apparently happening in november, I'm curious what Riot's definition of a healthy assassin is. 

Personally I think it's an assassin that can pull off his job but offers plenty of opportunity for counterplay.

I could bring up Zed as an argument because you can counterplay his assassination by building qss or zhonyas, but I feel like being able to just build an item to completely nullify his ult isn't very good counterplay. Plus he is very safe in his assassination attempt, something goes wrong he just blinks out. That isn't exactly high risk gameplay.

Another assassin we have is Rengar, and people don't like him because when he is fed you see him and suddenly your adc is dead. He doesn't however, have a great escape UNLESS he still has his ult after the kill. Atleast that is some sort of a tradeoff, but getting instantly deleted isn't exactly super healthy gameplay.

So i guess the lines are really blurred when it comes to what is a healthy assassin. I'm curious what Riot/anyone has to say about what a healthy assassin would be like.

A healthy assassin
-has to acquire damage items to remain relevant and continue assassinating
-has to outplay or out think you to get a kill on even terms
-has the tools to outplay you and the damage to kill you
-has opportunities for its target to fight back that are *effective*
-has difficulty recovering from failed assassinations
-has little effect on a fight if abilities are used improperly

These are three horribly designed champions, but they're still overall far better than the rest of their class. They're squishy, lack durability and don't get to escape fights for free. Once they commit they're all in, that's what an assassin should be like.

It's very easy to turn around an kill one of them when they get into your team. This is because they commit to fights, which other assassins don't.

They also don't burst you 100-0 most of time. They have to be incredibly fed to do this. Akali will generally chunk you out and rely on her shroud while Talon will do the same with his ult. Comparitivly an Ekko will CC you an kill you in the stun duration, if he plays right there isn't a correct reaction because anyone who could react is stunned. Zed drops his entire combo on you in half a second then peaces out. Either it kills you or chunks you, either way it's far harder to react to than Akali or Talon.

I'll be the first to admit that Akali, Talon and Shaco are terribly designed champs, I just think the rest of the assassin class is designed even worse than they are.

Personally I believe there can be 2 different forms of healthy assassins. 

1. The highly mobile assassin.
   - Relatively safe due to lots of mobility
   - Abilities have counter play to them such has dodging, delays, or blocking
   - Due to the above, unreliable burst pattern yet still a safe pick. They won't necessarily kill their target, but they won't die easily if they fail.

2. The highly reliable assassin.
   - Low counterplay but telegraphed burst.
   - Mostly single target damage
   - Only reliable escape is their ultimate (if they have any escape it all)
   - Once they burst their target, they have no easy way out meaning they usually 1 for 1 in fights.

Regardless of which one an assassin is they also should be squishy and required to by damage items to continue killing their targets. Ekko and Zed are the closest to being healthy by the first category, but Ekko gets away with too much tank in his build, and Zed is a tad too reliable. Talon, Nocturne and Rengar are the best examples of the second category, but I feel Rengar doesn't telegraph enough, Nocturne is more of a bruiser and Talon can fairly easily kill multiple champions.

It depends on what point of view you're coming from

Many people argue that assassins shouldn't be in the game, but I don't feel passionately about that one way or another.

I don't think a champion is cancerous when they kill a lot of people. We know this game isn't all about KDA. However it never feels good to die, and that's the whole reason the assassin class exists, to deal high amounts of damage. That's it.

It's easier to blame them instead of taking responsibility for a silly mistake you made, and that's almost all of the deaths that happen against assassins, or at least that's how it used to be. Now it's hard to catch these champions, and when you do they sustain damage quite well.

I believe assassins get out of hand when we try to make them a more reliable pick. I can play against a fed feast or famine champion. I know what's going to happen when they hit their 3rd kill, and really we all should know. Even so, there's a reason those types of champions thrived in low ELO.

Assassins are cheesy champions by nature. They rely on getting kills early game so they can run around the map taking out other champions who are out of position, standing near an unwarded bush, or split pushing alone. **They should thrive on disorganized teams.** They should never be a huge threat outside of 1v1 or 1v2 situations.

A healthy assassin should have high mobility, deal a lot of damage, and have little to no CC. Any sort of lockdown, silence, or escape is toxic when an assassin has it.

They also need to be quite squishy so that any sort of lockdown messes them up. That's the trade that needs to be made for the high mobility and damage. When you add escapes, hard CC, or any sort of reliability into an assassin's kit, they become too oppressive.

If an assassin is building defensive stats then they should be significantly punished for doing that. That's the way it used to be, but now there aren't really anymore true glass canon assassins. Fiora got a rework, and even Yasuo builds Maw of Malmortius, Guardian Angel, and Sterak's Gage now. 

Currently I would say Katarina, Kassadin, and Ahri fit the bill, but I believe that's more because of how mages aren't really at the center of the meta right now. AP assassins like Fizz and LeBlanc remain commonly picked and banned because their kits are problematic when you deal a lot of raw damage.

AD Assassins are even worse at the moment. Off the top of my head, I could only think of Shaco as the least problematic, and he's not all AD.

Adding on to some of the points from the best comments...

*Damage should be primarily single-target*, because their main job is just to kill, and not massacre.

Nocturne is the healthiest assassin in the game. He has hard diving power, mobility, outplay potential and stickiness. He doesn't have hard burst, so he never 100-0s you, but if you let him get ahead, you're really going to have a bad time.

There is no counterplay there outside of a Zhonyas.  You aren't positioning wrong, you aren't doing anything wrong, she just has superior maneuverability, damage, and the ability to not need to aim to hit you with 80% of her damage in the kit.
